noun.description: A bird, often vividly colored, with a short down-curved hooked bill, grasping feet, and a raucous voice, found especially in the tropics and feeding on fruits and seeds. Many are popular as cage birds, and some are able to mimic the human voice.

examples: encouraging students to parrot back information

origin: Early 16th century: probably from dialect French perrot, diminutive of the male given name Pierre Peter. Compare with parakeet.
